titles.title: School Attendance Improves Lives Act of 2014
To condition the eligiblity of disabled children aged 16 or 17 for supplemental security income benefits on school attendance.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 5/8/2014--Introduced. School Attendance Improves Lives Act of 2014 - Amends title XVI (Supplemental Security Income) (SSI) of the Social Security Act to condition SSI benefits for disabled children aged 16 or 17 on school attendance, except where the Commissioner of Social Security determines that the individual has good medical cause to not attend school for part or all of a month.
